io.spine.reflect

Class Invokables

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.spine.reflect.Invokables

  • public final class Invokables
extends java.lang.Object
    A utility class for working with Java methods and instantiating objects using reflectively-obtained constructors.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static java.lang.invoke.MethodHandle asHandle(java.lang.reflect.Method method)
      Converts the given Method into a MethodHandle.
      static <C> C callParameterlessCtor(java.lang.Class<C> type)
      Attempts to create an instance of the specified type using a constructor without parameters.
      static java.lang.Object setAccessibleAndInvoke(java.lang.reflect.Method method, java.lang.Object target)
      Invokes the given argumentless method on the target ignoring the accessibility restrictions.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • asHandle

        public static java.lang.invoke.MethodHandle asHandle(java.lang.reflect.Method method)
        Converts the given Method into a MethodHandle.

        The accessibility parameter of the input method, i.e. method.isAccessible(), is preserved by this method. However, the attributes may be changes in a non-synchronized manner, i.e. the asHandle(..) is not designed to operate concurrently.

      • callParameterlessCtor

        public static <C> C callParameterlessCtor(java.lang.Class<C> type)
        Attempts to create an instance of the specified type using a constructor without parameters.

        If no such constructor exists, an IllegalArgumentException is thrown.

        The access level does not matter: the constructor is made accessible during the method execution. It is always restored after object instantiation or an error.

        Parameters:
        type - class to instantiate
        Returns:
        the object created using a parameterless constructor
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the class is abstract, or an exception is thrown in the parameterless constructor
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the specified class does not have a parameterless constructors. Note that nested classes fall under this case

      • setAccessibleAndInvoke

        public static java.lang.Object setAccessibleAndInvoke(java.lang.reflect.Method method,
                                                      java.lang.Object target)
        Invokes the given argumentless method on the target ignoring the accessibility restrictions.

        The target must be of the type that declares the given method, otherwise an IllegalStateException is thrown.

        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the target is not of the type that declares the given method or if an exception is thrown during the method invocation
